page.title: 03WINGERWORTH FOR THE ELDERLY
page.content: We talked to a villager who has lived in Wingerworth for 30 years. In that time she has seen the building of schools, shops, houses, footpaths and street lights. She likes the village because of the people who live here, the open space, the Lido, the parks, the shops and the Parish Rooms. There is a club for the{'Over 60's' which meets once a week for a hot meal in the Parish Rooms. Dominoes and other games and outings are also organised for the members. She does think that, with all the new houses being built, the village is getting too big, she certainly doesn't want the Green Belt land to be built on. She would like to have a permanent library to use, and a medical centre built.
